gameDetails.matchup: Tarleton State Texans vs Houston Christian Huskies

recentPerformance.hitRate: Home underdogs covering at high rate
recentPerformance.seasonAverage: HCU playing well at Sharp Gymnasium
recentPerformance.cushion: Getting points as home team is unusual

keyFactors.title: Home Team Listed as Underdog
keyFactors.description: Houston Christian is at home but getting points. Model suggested HCU should be laying -2.5, not getting +1.5. That's 4 points of value.

keyFactors.title: Tarleton State Overvalued
keyFactors.description: Market overreacting to Tarleton's early season results. Sample size too small to justify making them road favorites.

keyFactors.title: Sharp Money Indicators
keyFactors.description: Line moved from +2.5 to +1.5 - professional money on HCU. When sharps back home dogs, pay attention.

keyFactors.title: Model Projection
keyFactors.description: Model had HCU winning by 3-4 points. Getting +1.5 when should be -2.5 is significant edge.

quarterBreakdown.description: Tight game throughout. Houston Christian led by 3 at the break. Defense setting the tone with forced turnovers.
Huskies went on 12-2 run midway through. Tarleton couldn't find offensive rhythm against HCU defense. Won by 7.

gameResults.whenCleared: Not only covered the +1.5 spread but won the game outright by 7 points. Double-victory.
gameResults.gamePace: HCU controlled tempo with defense. 18 forced turnovers disrupted Tarleton's offensive flow.

whatWentRight.title: Won Outright as Underdog
whatWentRight.description: Not only covered +1.5 but won the game 72-65. The model correctly identified HCU as the better team despite being listed as dogs.

whatWentRight.title: Defensive Dominance
whatWentRight.description: 18 forced turnovers was the story. HCU's defense suffocated Tarleton State and created easy scoring opportunities.

whatWentRight.title: Sharp Money Validated
whatWentRight.description: Line movement from +2.5 to +1.5 showed sharps were all over HCU. Following the smart money paid off.

whatWentRight.title: Model Projection Was Accurate
whatWentRight.description: Model had HCU by 3-4 points. They won by 7. Edge was even larger than projected.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was edge realization, not luck. The model correctly identified the mispricing. HCU winning outright by 7 as a +1.5 dog shows the market was significantly wrong on this game.

closingLineValue.verdict: Solid positive CLV. Line moved toward HCU after our bet. Market agreed we had the right side.

keyTakeaways: Home underdogs in college basketball offer exceptional value
Sharp money support on home dogs is a strong signal
Model identified HCU as better team despite odds
Winning outright as underdog is ideal outcome
Early season mispricings in small conferences are exploitable
verdict: Outstanding result. Model correctly identified HCU as the better team despite being listed as underdogs. Won outright by 7 when just needed +1.5. This is the exact type of mispricing we target in early-season college basketball.
